intro: Pterocaulon pycnostachyum, commonly known as the dense-stemmed pterocaulon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
